tutorial.description: Before you donate plasma it is important to understand the plasma donation process, its risks, and your responsibilities as a donor. It is essential for you to review the materials on this page before your first donation. If you are unable to donate at the center the day you complete these tasks, you will need to review the materials again prior to donatation.

sections.name: section_new_donor_welcome_letter
sections.caption: New Donor Welcome Letter
sections.description: This document includes general information regarding what to expect when visiting an ImmunoTek Donor Center.

sections.name: section_informed_consent
sections.caption: Informed Consent for Automated Plasmapheresis
sections.description: This document explains what to expect during the plasma collection procedure, donation rules and regulations, possible effects or reactions, testing, and agreeance to participate in the program.

sections.caption: Medication List
sections.description: This document outlines a list of medications that could have a harmful impact on the donor or the end patient. Please review thoroughly.

sections.name: section_trvl_risk_poster
sections.caption: Travel Risk Poster
sections.description: Visiting or having a blood transfusion in certain countries could impact ability to donate. Please review thoroughly.

sections.description: An explanation of the Cross-Donation Check System, risks associated with cross-donation, and agreeance to ImmunoTek's regulations.

sections.name: section_nd_handout
sections.caption: New Donor Handout
sections.description: Review of documentation new donors must bring to the donation center for their first visit to be eligible to complete the registration process.

sections.name: section_new_donor_ending
sections.caption: Thank you for completing this tutorial. Next you will answer a series of questions relating to your health history. The first time you donate you will receive the long form of this questionnaire, and for most returning visits you will receive a short form. It is crucial that you respond to each question accurately. We may review some of your answers during your visit to our plasma center.
